attributes.action: Accountability of facts and information used in political campaigns ie EU RFRDUM
attributes.additional_details:
EU referendum: The claims that won it for Brexit fact checked (Telegraph 24-6-2016)
“The EU now costs the UK over £350 million every week – nearly £20 billion a year”
Vote Leave campaign 
Verdit (Wrong)
“The UK consistently loses in the EU because other members favour a highly regulated and protectionist economy”
Jacob ReesMogg
Verdict: Wrong
“Two thirds of British jobs in manufacturing are dependent on demand from Europe”
Alan Johnson
Verdict: Wrong

culture of criminally wrong information Stop
attributes.background: In recent EU Referendum both sides of campaign Leave and Remain used various facts and information to aid their side of argument such as “The EU now costs the UK over £350 million every week – nearly £20 billion a year”. Many facts as this were misrepresented, thus misleading people to vote.
